com.vividsolutions.jcs.conflate.roads.nodematch
Class NodeMatching

java.lang.Object
  com.vividsolutions.jcs.conflate.roads.nodematch.NodeMatching
public class NodeMatching
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a possible way of matching the edges around two nodes. An edge of a node may either match an edge in the other node (which is a symmetric relationship) or be unmatched.

Constructor Summary

Method Detail

nodeDistanceMatchValue

public static double nodeDistanceMatchValue(double maxDistance,
                                            double candidateDistance)
Computes a match value based on the distance between the matched nodes. Value is normalized to lie in [0,1], based on the maximum allowable distance value.

Parameters:
maxDistance - the maximum distance allowed between matched nodes
candidateDistance - the distance between two matched nodes
Returns:
a match value between 0 and 1

getEdgeMatches

public java.util.List getEdgeMatches()
Get a list of all the MatchEdges around the first node in this matching. Note that unmatched edges around either match node will not be present in this list.

Returns:

exactTopoMatchValue

angleDistanceMatchValue

public double angleDistanceMatchValue(double nodeDistanceTolerance)
Combines match values for both edge angle matches and node distance

angleDistTopoSignificanceAdjustedMatchValue

public double angleDistTopoSignificanceAdjustedMatchValue(double nodeDistanceTolerance)
Compute a match value based on the node distance and topology, but reduced if one of the nodes is a 2-node. Idea is that nodes which are not very topologically significant should have lower match values.

Parameters:
nodeDistanceTolerance -
Returns:
